title: Is Katy Perry's career over now that her first song in 4 years has flopped? - Quora

response.answer_text: Maybe and no. WHY NO? Katy Perry has a HUGE back catalogue of hits. She can make $10s of millions of dollars a year in TOURING REVENUE for pretty much the rest of her life as a legacy artist, even if she never gets another radio spin PERIOD.WHY MAYBE? Technically, Katy Perry has actually now had about 4–7 flops in a row, depending on how you count. Since “Dark Horse” pretty much every single has performed worse than the last.Her current album is easily the biggest fall from grace since Lady Gaga’s Artpop era, which ironically started with negative comparisons to Katy Perry’s #1 hit “Roar.” See my answer to a related question here: Peter Daines's answer to Did Katy Perry's latest album Witness flop both critically and commercially?Her 3 most recent singles are easily the 3 worst performing in her entire career by a mile. They have all peaked below #200 in overall radio airplay per All your music data needs in one place (billboard doesn’t report on radio airplay for songs that don’t chart, and also generally doesn’t release actual numbers; NOTE: kworb.net radio numbers actually come from Mediabase, which is a very reputable organization).KP’s label dumped a LOT of money on her recent music videos & they got a LOT of views. It’s possible that they aren’t done dumping money into her career & that gives her hope for a high production comeback with her next album. But for now, KP’s name on a song is actually kindof toxic.

No one’s career is ever technically OVER, because you can keep doing things to make it better. Especially artists, their career is over ONLY when they die. Abraham Lincoln’s story is proof :  So no, no one’s career is ever over. You should just know how to build a meaningful career. :)
